paper_metadata.title: Estimating the causal effect of Funds to Combat Poverty on poverty reduction in Brazil's Northeast region

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: No specific mention of cash transfers or allowances in program description

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: No specific mention of asset transfers in program description

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: The results provide evidence of a positive impact of the policy on reducing poverty
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: We applied the generalized synthetic control method to evaluate this policy

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: This article estimates the causal effect of an anti-poverty mechanism dating to early this century called 'Funds to Combat Poverty' (Fundos de Combate à Pobreza -FCP)
evidence_citations.country_citation: In Brazil, although the effects have been more modest, the leading program emerging from the FCP, 'Family Stipend' (Bolsa Família), has reduced the quadratic poverty gap by 15%
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: The Northeast is considered the region with the highest poverty rate
